overview_of_class: Chemistry 210-3 is a continuation of Chemistry 210-1, and 210-2 and relies heavily on the foundation provided by those courses to elaborate the structures and properties of polyfunctional compounds of biochemical and medicinal interest. Also covered are topics in molecular orbital theory, polymer chemistry, organic synthesis, bioorganic chemistry, and recent developments in organic chemistry.
name: Organic Chemistry
title: WCAS CHEM 210-3-23 Organic Chemistry
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 230-3.
Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Chemistry 210-3 is a continuation of Chemistry 210-1, and 210-2 and relies heavily on the foundation provided by those courses to elaborate the structures and properties of polyfunctional compounds of biochemical and medicinal interest. Also covered are topics in molecular orbital theory, polymer chemistry, organic synthesis, bioorganic chemistry, and recent developments in organic chemistry.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: Grade of C- or better in Chemistry 210-2 and Chemistry 230-2.

Students enrolled in this course MUST also enroll in the associated laboratory course, Chem 230-3.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, by L.G. Wade, Pearson ($144.20 new, looseleaf)***

2. Turning Technologies Response Card Model QT or NXT ("Clicker") and associated 1 year license ($55.00 new; $44 used)***

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (4/4/17). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower price.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
1. Solutions for Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, Jan Simek, Pearson ($236.15 new; $177.10 used)***

2. Molecular Modeling Kit ($41.15 new; $30.85 used)***

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (4/4/17). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower price.
